conclusion: The question asks how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves backward.
The image shows four objects above slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
When the light source moves backward, the distance between the light source and the objects increases.
As the distance between the light source and the objects increases, the shadows cast by the objects will become smaller.
The shadows will also move backward, following the direction of the light source.
Therefore, A, B, C, and D will all move backward and become smaller.
